title: Software Engineering Intern
description: Developed an internal package management registry website using Next.js, Docker, and C#, optimizing developer workflows by centralizing package information and enhancing discoverability.
Engineered a responsive frontend with Next.js and Tailwind CSS, facilitating seamless search, navigation, and metadata display for 150+ packages, similar to npm and Crates.io.

Authored a comprehensive API specification and implemented robust backend services in C# to store, retrieve, and process package metadata from JFrog REST API and Git repositories, ensuring accurate data presentation.
Ensured code quality by writing extensive unit tests with NUnit, covering all backend functionalities from data retrieval to processing.

title: Teaching Assistant
company: Duke University Departments of CS and ECE
description: Assisted with 3 courses across the CS and ECE departments (Design and Analysis of Algorithms, Computer Architecture, and Discrete Math), consistently earning high satisfaction ratings in course evaluations.
Led recitations for over 100+ students, simplifying complex concepts and facilitating discussions on practical application of course material to strengthen students' understanding.
Held regular office hours helping students master challenging topics and enhance their problem-solving skills.

title: Research Assistant
description: Tested different segmentation models for improving edge detection in images specifically related to detecting bubbles.
Labeled training data to improve distinction and visibility between bubbles.

title: Research Assistant
description: Implemented and compared regression models for optimal accuracy (MAPE, R2) using Python, Pandas, and Jupyter Notebook for predicting lithium compounds with high ion conductivity.
